summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense counsel regarding a victim's position on Ghislaine Maxwell's bail. The victim opposes bail but does not wish to make a formal statement, and the government will convey this opposition to the court in accordance with the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA).

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail discussion in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, confirming the victim's position on bail for inclusion in a court filing.

connections.description: The prosecutor is representing the government in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Government Bail Filing
events.description: The government plans to file a document with the court conveying a victim's opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail.

keyFacts: A victim in the U.S. v. Maxwell case believes Maxwell should not be granted bail.
The victim does not wish to make a specific statement but consents to the government conveying her opposition to the court.
The government will act in accordance with the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) to convey this position.
This email coordinates the legal strategy for the government's upcoming bail-related court filing.
